Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: in reserved handle zone, black-figure decoration; to right, handle palmette with red centre and white dots; to its left lower half of a draped male figure, with red and white dot rosettes on the drapery; raised heel of second figure at break to left, with end of a staff, presumably held by the man to the right, cutting across it.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Heidelberg, Antikenmuseum I52-I77 and I85-I92 have in the past been erroneously known and cited as J52-77 and J85-92.
Bibliographic references: CVA Heidelberg IV / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Deutschland Heidelberg, Universität (p. 51, no. 12, pl. 166)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1387) (phase 3)
